title: Cloud Developer
description:
**Plats:** Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö.
  
**Varaktighet:** 6 till 18 månader (Möjlighet till förlängning), beroende på kundens behov.
  
**Anställningsform:** Konsultuppdrag.
  
Imployy växer!!
  
Just nu utökar vi vår kandidatbank med de mest kvalificerade kandidaterna för att matcha dem med både befintliga och nya kunder. Vi är engagerade i att hitta den perfekta matchningen för varje kandidat och varje tjänst.
  
  

**Arbetsbeskrivning:**  

Vi söker en skicklig Cloud Developer som vill bli en del av vårt team och arbeta med innovativa molnbaserade lösningar för vår kund.
  
I denna roll kommer du att designa, utveckla och underhålla skalbara och säkra molnapplikationer samt samarbeta med tvärfunktionella team för att leverera högpresterande system.
  
  

**Arbetsuppgifter:**  

Designa och implementera molnnativa applikationer med ledande molnplattformar (AWS, Azure eller GCP).
  
Utveckla infrastruktur som kod (IaC) och CI/CD-pipelines för molnbaserade deployment-flöden.
  
Säkerställa systemets tillförlitlighet, säkerhet och prestanda i distribuerade miljöer.
  
Samarbeta med DevOps-, säkerhets- och arkitektteam för att ta fram helhetslösningar.
  
Övervaka och felsöka molnsystem för att upprätthålla hög tillgänglighet och skalbarhet.
  
  

**Krav för att söka tjänsten:**  

Akademisk examen inom datavetenskap, teknik eller ett närliggande område.
  
Dokumenterad erfarenhet av molnutveckling med AWS, Azure eller Google Cloud.
  
Goda kunskaper i programmeringsspråk såsom Python, Go, Java eller Node.js.
  
Erfarenhet av Docker, Kubernetes och CI/CD-verktyg (t.ex. GitHub Actions, Jenkins).
  
Förståelse för nätverk, säkerhet och identitetshantering i molnmiljöer.
  
Flytande i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.
  
  

**Följande är meriterande:**  

Certifieringar såsom AWS Certified Developer, Azure Developer Associate eller GCP Professional Cloud Developer.
  
Kännedom om serverlös arkitektur och mikrotjänster.
  
Erfarenhet av övervakningsverktyg som Prometheus, Grafana eller Datadog.
  
  

**Varför jobba med oss? Vad vi erbjuder:**  

* Möjlighet att arbeta med meningsfulla projekt hos förstklassiga kunder.
* Konkurrenskraftig lön och förmåner.
* En inkluderande arbetsmiljö där alla är välkomna.
* En stödjande och utvecklingsinriktad arbetsplats.
* Vi har kollektivavtal, vilket innebär trygga anställningsvillkor, tjänstepension, försäkringar och andra förmåner.


Ditt CV och dina uppgifter kommer att sparas i vår databas, och vi kommer att se till att matcha dem med rätt kund och rätt tjänst när möjligheten uppstår. Vi genomför intervjuer löpande och ser fram emot att välkomna vår nästa kollega till teamet.
  
På Imployy är vi engagerade i att bygga en mångsidig och talangfull arbetsstyrka genom att koppla samman skickliga yrkespersoner med rätt möjligheter. Vi fokuserar på att matcha kandidater baserat på deras expertis, erfarenhet och karriärmål. Vår arbetsmetod präglas av integritet, innovation och en passion för att skapa meningsfulla karriärvägar.
  
För att läsa mer om oss och vad vi gör, besök gärna www.imployy.com.
  
Öppen för alla
  
Vi fokuserar på din kompetens, inte dina övriga förutsättningar. Vi är öppna för att anpassa rollen eller arbetsplatsen efter dina behov.

Vi söker en skicklig Fullstackutvecklare som vill bli en del av vårt team och bidra till spännande projekt för vår kund.

title: Developer ASIC Backend
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About the Opportunity**

  

Join Ericsson’s cutting-edge journey to shape the future of 5G networks! As an ASIC Backend Developer, you’ll work on pioneering digital ASIC designs vital to Ericsson’s mobile network infrastructure. Our team, responsible for the final critical stage of chip design before fabrication, thrives on Lean and Agile principles, promoting close collaboration, daily progress-sharing, and continuous improvement. If you’re passionate about advanced technology and ready to make a meaningful impact in telecom, this role is crafted just for you.

  

At Ericsson, we support your growth, offering opportunities to advance your skills while contributing to game-changing 5G/6G technologies. Here, you’ll find a supportive, innovative environment focused on quality, teamwork, and career development. Join us and help shape the future of telecom!

 **What You’ll Do:**  

* Engage in all backend development tasks, including synthesis, constraints development, equivalence checking, and place-and-route to deliver high-quality digital ASICs.
* Run Static Timing Analysis, timing sign-off, and optimize timing/area/power using Synopsys tools (Design Compiler, PrimeTime, ICC2/FC/Innovus).
* Work extensively with EDA tools and develop scripts (Python, TCL, Linux Shell) to automate processes and enhance project efficiency.
* Drive innovations in low-power design using UPF and provide input on physical implementation and floor planning.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams in a supportive, knowledge-sharing environment, ensuring seamless integration and execution.
 **What You’ll Bring:**  

* Expertise in backend development, specialising in synthesis, STA, and power optimisation in semiconductors. 5+ years of development experience through multiple successful ASIC tape-outs.
* Hands-on Knowledge and proficiency in EDA tools (Synopsys Design Compiler, Fusion Compiler, PrimeTime, ICC2/Innovus, Formality/LEC ) for timing, area, power closure on advanced technology nodes.
* Proficiency in scripting languages (Python, Perl, TCL, and Linux Shell) to automate and streamline workflows.
* Comfortable in UNIX/Linux environments, essential for efficient and effective backend operations.
* Commitment to Quality is a keen eye for detail and experience maintaining high standards in complex, high-impact projects.
* Extensive experience in low-power design techniques, including UPF application and VHDL/System Verilog for RTL2GDS flows.
* Looking for a skilled professional experienced in crafting timing constraints to effectively manage and control the timing aspects of complex design projects.
* A collaborative mindset with a strong focus on innovative solutions and continuous improvement in fast-paced environments.
* Solid communication skills, able to explain technical topics clearly and collaborate effectively across teams.
 **Bonus Skills:**  

* It is nice to have experience in leading technical teams and working with Multi/Many-Core CPU architectures.
* Proficient in Clear Case, Git, and Synopsys tools like Spyglass, Design Compiler, and Formality for optimised backend development.
* Familiarity with mobile communication standards, telecom, floor planning, and physical implementation to enhance ASIC design effectiveness.
**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


We encourage you to consider applying to jobs where you might not meet all the criteria. We recognize that we all have transferrable skills, and we can support you with the skills that you need to develop.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary country and city:** [[Sweden]] || [[Stockholm]]

**Primary Recruiter:** [[Anitha Pulluru]]

**Hiring Manager:** [[Anders Isaksson A]]

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Development at Nolimit City (part of Evolution AB) is a challenging and exciting role where you will be part of a team dedicated to creating solutions that redefine our industry. By working in small, highly collaborative teams, you and your team will have clear ownership of one of our most important new initiatives.
   

  

 At Nolimit City, we optimize for quality, fast flows, and iterative development with short feedback loops. We have a strong focus on end-to-end ownership, continuous improvement, monitoring, and experimentation. We strive to have teams that are inclusive, helpful, and have a strong sense of ownership for what they build. Our engineers make some of the most significant decisions for the company, and we are looking for open and curious developers. As part of the Nolimit City team, you will be part of one of Sweden's fastest-growing companies and contribute to creating value for our players worldwide.
   

  

 We are expanding several of our engineering teams, including the team working on new initiatives with innovative products for our end users and work on our core products.
   

  

 Although we prefer that you're working on-site we also undertand that you have a life outside of work, meaning that working remote from time to time, leaving early, coming in late etc is not something unusual for us. A bit of a cliche; but we do in fact offer a great deal of freedom but with that comes responsibility.
   

  

 What you'll do
   

  

* Own the product from start to finish. Decide how it is best built, tested, deployed, and monitored.
* Work with large-scale, highly available, and robust modern systems.
* Be an integral part of a team and its culture and ways of working.
* Work with automated deployment enabling release multiple times a day.
* Succeed, fail, and learn together with other competent and talented people. We believe in an environment that offers growth opportunities and see education as a result of failure that brings us closer to the next breakthrough.
* Take responsibility for system design, work together with domain architects, own end-to-end problems, manage stakeholder communication, and mentor junior engineers.


 Who you are
   

  

* Tech stack should include: JavaScript/TypeScript, Node.js, React, Java.
* Experience with advanced JavaScript libraries and frameworks
* Experience with APIs and product development
* A passion for writing clear and sustainable code
* Experience with agile methodologies, continuous integration, continuous delivery
* Good spoken and written English skills
* You thrive in an environment where you are responsible for your code and takes ownership of the change from editor to production system
* We understand that you might not have experience in all the areas listed above, but as long as you have the ambition and willingness to learn we would like to hear from you.


 Some of our technologies
   

  

* Javascript / TypeScript
* React / NextJS
* Redux / Redux-Toolkit Query
* Strapi (Headless CMS)
* Node.js and Express.js
* Java 17, Dropwizard
* MySQL
* PostgreSQL
* AWS, Ubuntu, Docker, GitHub Actions


 Who we are
   

  

 We are the best and fastest growing slot provider in the world with the operator and product in focus, and the mobile future on our minds. Nolimit is a team of experienced professionals from the gambling industry in Stockholm, Sweden, Malta and Gurugram, India. Our company has derived from hands on work at some of the most successful gambling software providers and operators over the last 15 years. Our mission is to offer a fast, reliable and flexible team that cooperates with the best operators in the world, taking gambling to the next level.
   

  

 We have a clean code high performance modern mini/micro service portable system platform for mobile and desktop that is 100 % under our own control. Since we have our own platform, this allows us to deliver special features and smooth, customizable marketing campaigns that are tailored to the operator's specific needs. We think it's time for a new angle to the gambling software industry – one where the product is in focus and we fully engage their promotion, marketing and country manager system/activities with our games. Nolimit work with customers on a global scale and the largest gambling operators in the world have our games everywhere.
   

  

 Nolimit City, Stockholm based development team. We provide you with your choice of OS and IDE.
   

  

 Send your application to hr-sweden@nolimitcity.com
   

  

 http://www.nolimitcity.com

title: C# | Senior Software Developer
description:
**Job Description**
 Are you a solution-oriented developer with a passion for writing robust, maintainable code? At Coherent in Järfälla, you'll be part of the team building software that drives state-of-the-art optoelectronic research and high-volume production.
   

  

**About Coherent**
 Coherent Corp. is a global leader in photonics and optoelectronics, operating across 73 sites in 18 countries.
   

  

 At our Järfälla facility, we design and manufacture advanced fiber-optic communication chips used in everything from short-range data centers to long-haul telecom networks. These high-performance solutions are central to cloud services, 5G expansion, and the AI ecosystem.
   

  

 With more than 330 engineers, technicians, and operators, our goal is clear: to lead through innovation and quality.
   

  

 The Role
   

  

 You Will Join a Small, Highly Skilled Team That Develops And Maintains The Software Systems Critical To Our Production Flow. Typical Work Includes
   

  

* Developing in-house applications such as our MES, chip-test infrastructure and service-maintenance tools
* Designing databases and systems, plus implementation, testing and maintenance
* Building CI/CD pipelines and driving automation across the factory
* Collaborating daily with colleagues in R&D, process engineering and operations to design new or improve existing solutions.


 Tech stack
   

  

* C#, .NET / .NET Core (primary)
* WPF and/or Blazor (highly valued)
* SQL Server (design & advanced querying)
* ORM frameworks: Entity Framework, Dapper
* RavenDB or other document databases (nice to have)
* Azure DevOps & CI/CD pipelines


 What you bring
   

  

* MSc/BSc in Computer Science, Engineering Physics or similar
* 5+ years of hands-on C# development
* Solid software-design and debugging skills
* Proficiency in English; Swedish is a plus


 Voices from the Team
   

  

*“It’s a great feeling to come into work every day and collaborate with my team of incredibly skilled, inventive, and ambitious developers. Watching the systems we build genuinely make the whole organization better is immensely rewarding.”*
 Tomas Jonsson – Manager Software Systems Engineering
   

  

*“When I started working here, one of the first feeling I got was that I found my way home. Awesome colleagues, interesting and challenging work.”*
 Mikael Gustavsson – Senior Software Developer
   

  

 Why Coherent?
   

  

 At Coherent, you’ll work at the forefront of technology in a supportive and collaborative environment. Our site in Järfälla combines global innovation with local expertise and a strong sense of community.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* Cutting-edge technology and impactful work
* A diverse, international team
* Opportunities for both technical and leadership development
* A culture built on our ICARE values: Integrity, Collaboration, Accountability, Respect, and Enthusiasm


 Culture Commitment
   

  

 We work hard to ensure adherence to the company’s values (ICARE) in all aspects of your position at Coherent:
   

  

* Integrity – Create an Environment of Trust
* Collaboration – Innovate Through the Sharing of Ideas
* Accountability – Own the Process and the Outcome
* Respect – Recognize the Value in Everyone
* Enthusiasm – Find a Sense of Purpose in Work


 Practical Information
   

  

 Start: As agreed
   

  

 Location: Järfälla – On Site
   

  

 Scope: Full-time
   

  

 Ready to build the next generation of opto-electronic manufacturing tools?
   

  

 Submit your CV and a brief cover letter through our recruitment system.
   

  

 Please note that reference and background checks will be conducted as part of the process.
   

  

**About Us**
 Coherent is a global leader in lasers, engineered materials and networking components. We are a vertically integrated manufacturing company that develops innovative products for diversified applications in the industrial, optical communications, military, life sciences, semiconductor equipment, and consumer markets. Coherent provides a comprehensive career development platform within an environment that challenges employees to perform at their best, while rewarding excellence and hard-work through a competitive compensation program. It's an exciting opportunity to work for a company that offers stability, longevity and growth. Come Join Us!
   

  

**Note to recruiters and employment agencies:** 
 We will not pay for unsolicited resumes from recruiters and employment agencies unless we have a signed agreement and have required assistance, in writing, for a specific opening.
   

  

 LinkedIn

title: Perception Software Engineer
description:
**Company**
 Qualcomm Auto Ltd Sweden Filial
   

  

**Job Area**
 Engineering Group, Engineering Group > Software Engineering
   

  

**General Summary**
 Are you passionate about advancing
 **ADAS** 
 and
 **Autonomous Driving** 
 systems? Imagine contributing to a safer world while collaborating with brilliant, creative, and enjoyable colleagues. Dive into exciting and challenging technology—apply today for this rewarding opportunity!
   

  

**We are Perception within Qualcomm Automotive**
 Qualcomm is an American multinational corporation known for our creation of semiconductors, software, and services related to wireless technology.
   

  

 Our Perception organization belong to the Automotive branch delivering the Snapdragon Digital Chassis - a set of cloud-connected platforms for telematics and connectivity, digital cockpit, and driver assistance and autonomy.
   

  

 As a Perception Software Engineer at Qualcomm Automotive, you will design, develop, create, modify and validate state-of-the-art computer vision software for autonomous driving and advanced driver assistance systems. You will be part of Requirement Area Spatial Awareness, working closely with experts in different areas within computer vision. You will have the opportunity to contribute with your expertise as well as learn from other highly skilled developers. Together you develop algorithms for Detection of Freespace, i.e. Drivable area for the vehicle, enabling autonomous braking, adaptive cruise control and high-level autonomy.
   

  

 As a member of one of our cross functional teams, you will be performing tasks covering all parts of the product development cycle, including software design, machine learning, hands on work with data, testing, writing requirements and functional safety.
   

  

**Minimum Qualifications**
* Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 4+ years of Software Engineering or related work experience.


 OR
   

  

 Master's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 3+ years of Software Engineering or related work experience.
   

  

 OR
   

  

 PhD in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 2+ years of Software Engineering or related work experience.
   

  

* 2+ years of work experience with Programming Language such as C, C++, Java, Python, etc.


 As a person, we are looking for you who have a drive and “can do”-attitude, as well as the willingness to learn and expand your skillset in new areas. We also believe you are highly motivated and a pragmatic problem solver. Preferably, you also have previous experience from leadership positions as Team Lead or Tech Lead.
   

  

 We are looking for someone who matches at least 2-3 of the descriptions below:
   

  

* Software Development: You have a robust software development background, preferably complemented by expertise in system design and architecture (required).
* Language and Tools: Proficiency in languages and tools for machine learning and SW development, particularly and C/C++, python and tensorflow.
* Machine Learning: You bring practical experience in machine learning development, gained from relevant industry contexts. This includes practical experience of working with and developing the datasets used.
* Computer Vision: You have experience from applying algorithms to solve complex problems within Computer Vision.


**Preferred Qualification**
* Master’s degree or PhD in Engineering Physics, Machine Learning, Computer Science or related field.
* 8+ years of Software Engineering, Computer Vision, Machine learning and/or related work experience.
* 1+ years in leadership position (Team Lead, Tech Lead, Project Lead or similar)
* References to a particular number of years experience are for indicative purposes only. Applications from candidates with equivalent experience will be considered, provided that the candidate can demonstrate an ability to fulfill the principal duties of the role and possesses the required competencies.


 Qualcomm is an equal opportunity employer. If you are an individual with a disability and need an accommodation during the application/hiring process, rest assured that Qualcomm is committed to providing an accessible process. You may e-mail disability-accomodations@qualcomm.com or call Qualcomm's toll-free number found here. Upon request, Qualcomm will provide reasonable accommodations to support individuals with disabilities to be able participate in the hiring process. Qualcomm is also committed to making our workplace accessible for individuals with disabilities. (Keep in mind that this email address is used to provide reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities. We will not respond here to requests for updates on applications or resume inquiries).
   

  

 Qualcomm expects its employees to abide by all applicable policies and procedures, including but not limited to security and other requirements regarding protection of Company confidential information and other confidential and/or proprietary information, to the extent those requirements are permissible under applicable law.
   

  

**To all Staffing and Recruiting Agencies** 
 : Our Careers Site is only for individuals seeking a job at Qualcomm. Staffing and recruiting agencies and individuals being represented by an agency are not authorized to use this site or to submit profiles, applications or resumes, and any such submissions will be considered unsolicited. Qualcomm does not accept unsolicited resumes or applications from agencies. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Qualcomm employees or any other company location. Qualcomm is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes/applications.
   

  

 If you would like more information about this role, please contact Qualcomm Careers.

title: Freelance Software Developer (Ruby) - AI Trainer
description:
At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.
   

  

**What We Do**
 The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.
   

  

**About The Role**
 GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Coding, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.
   

  

 Although every project is unique, you might typically:
   

  

* Generate prompts that challenge AI
* Define comprehensive scoring criteria to evaluate the accuracy of the AI's answers
* Correct the model's responses based on your domain-specific knowledge


**How To Get Started**
 Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.
   

  

**Requirements**
* You have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Software Development, Computer Science, or other related fields.
* You have at least 3 years of professional experience with Ruby
* Code review experience is a must
* Experience with AI projects is a plus
* Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
* You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
* Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge


**Benefits**
**Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?**
* Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
* Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
* Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise

title: C# Gameplay developer / programmer (backend)
description:
***Please note - this is an in-house role in our Stockholm office. Remote candidates will not be considered. Unfortunately we cannot help with relocation from other countries or VISA applications.***




  





**About us** 




  





 Hacksaw Studios is a company that builds online games. Our games can be played both in social gaming and real money modes. We have wide distribution and our games are played by millions of people every month by players all over the world.
 



  





 We are currently looking to expand our development team with 2-3 additional developers. You will be part of our game development team and work in a tight knit team involving both back-end developers, mathematicians, front-end developers and designers/artists. Your task will be to bring our game ideas to life in co-operation with the designers and product owners.
 



  





 We offer a nice office in central Stockholm, an opportunity to work with other experienced game developers as well as a co-ownership program for suitable candidates.
 



  





**Your tasks will include:** 




  





 - Working with the development and design team to implement the backend gameplay mechanics behind our various games
 



  





 - Working with the front-end development team to ensure the backend communications protocols make their work as simple as possible
 



  





 - Working with the game design team to implement their game ideas
 



  





 - Implementing the mathematical model underlying the games
 



  





 - Performing statistical modelling and testing to ensure the games behave as intended (We'll teach you this part)
 



  





 - Learning about the online gaming industry and stay up to date on current trends and what is popular with players
 



  





 - Participating in code reviews and merge requests
 



  





 - Co-operating with colleagues with similar roles, both in-house and with our partners
 



  





**Required skills and experience:** 




  





 - A solid backend development background
 



  





 - Experience with a programming language suited for game development, such as C#, Java or C++ (We use C#)
 



  





 - A high interest in or education in mathematics or statistics
 



  





**Other things that would be a bonus (but not required):** 




  





 - Experience with unit testing
 



  





 - University degree in a related field
 



  





 - A personal interest in gaming

title: Senior Full Stack Software Engineer (Java) - ZEOS
company_industry: Technology, Information and Internet, Retail, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Over the last years, we learned that solving fulfillment-related challenges for the good of our customers helps us to fuel the growth of our platform. With more partners in Partner Program and Connected Retail joining our platform, we have been developing and testing additional further fulfilment services tailored to their needs.
   

  

 As a Senior Full Stack Software Engineer at ZEOS, Zalando’s B2B Logistics unit developing Europe’s leading Logistics Platform recently launched under the ZEOS Logistics brand, you will be part of a team working on designing technical solutions to connect various e-commerce platforms seamlessly with the robust logistics ecosystem of ZEOS.
   

  

 You will ensure that all our operational processes like warehousing, inventory management, inventory distribution, deliveries and returns can be steered on various e-commerce platforms. You will have the chance to learn about the broad business background we’re working with. In line with the overall Zalando philosophy you bring visibility and transparency to processes and thus have a huge impact on our customers and key stakeholders.
   

  

**WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)**
* You work regularly with others to ensure the right software/engineering design approaches and methodologies are applied.
* Design, develop, deploy, operate and improve software solutions that have a direct impact on our daily business with our partners.
* Discuss and design APIs and integrated solutions.
* Based on our microservices architecture, you and your team will own your code, and decide on the technologies and tools to deliver as well as operate large-scale applications on AWS.
* Working like a startup in an agile environment & taking ownership for the whole development cycle - from architecture design to testing to implementation & maintenance. Write applications from scratch with the latest technologies free of your choice.
* Shape and champion an inclusive culture and diverse team environment.


**WE'D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF**
* 10+ years of software engineering experience
* You have a deep understanding of microservice architecture, REST services and API design. Good knowledge of security concepts. Highly versed in deploying and operating applications in a cloud infrastructure.
* You are highly skilled as a Java Developer. Proven experience in frameworks like Spring Boot. Ideally you have experience with a distributed event store such as Apache Kafka.
* Experience with Frontend technologies like JavaScript (ES6 / ES2015), React, Typescript, Webpack, CSS/HTML, and showing interest in full stack development is a big Plus!
* You have a good understanding of PostgreSQL and cloud architectures/platforms (preferably AWS). Check our Tech Radar for more information on the technologies we use at Zalando.
* Demonstrated strong sense of ownership, entrepreneurial & analytical thinking add to your excellent communication skills.
* Ideally, you have experience integrating third-party services, such as through developing or working with middleware solutions.
* Shopify or other e-commerce experience is a merit.


**OUR OFFER**
 Zalando provides a range of benefits, here’s an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.
   

  

  

* 40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners
* Hybrid working model with 60% remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
* Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
* 30 days of vacation a year
* Health and wellbeing options
* Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh\_src=22377bdd1us


*We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.*

title: Application Developer (RPG Fully Free Format) Team Connect
description:
Vi är ett snabbväxande företag och därför söker vi nu
   

  

**Application Developer (RPG** 
**Fully Free Format** 
**) till Team Connect**
 Söker du efter en spännande karriärmöjlighet där du kan vara spindeln i nätet?
   

  

**Din profil** 
 är nyfiken, social och gillar när det är många saker på gång. Du behöver vara flexibel, noggrann och ha öga för detaljer. Du är strukturerad, lättlärd och delar gärna med dig av din kunskap till dina kollegor. Du är en lagspelare som gärna tar ansvar och vill leverera lösningar med hög kvalitet.
   

  

 I rollen som Application Developer (RPG Fully Free Format) är intresset för teknik och utveckling det viktigaste verktyget och du behöver ha lätt att lära dig nya tekniker och sätt att jobba på.
   

  

**Du kommer** 
 att ingå i vårt team med produktägare, arkitekt, utvecklare och produktspecialister. Där kommer du främst få jobba med seniora och erfarna utvecklare och samarbeta för att komma fram till effektiva och stabila lösningar.
   

  

**Teamet består** 
 av glada och jordnära kollegor där flera har över 20 års erfarenhet inom Crosskey men även några med ett fåtal års erfarenhet inom Crosskey. Kamratskap och samarbete värderas mycket högt inom teamet. Teamet fungerar som spindeln i nätet, eftersom många av teamets produkter sammanfogar andra produkter och stödjer olika integrationer inom Crosskey.
   

  

**Vi önskar** 
 att du har erfarenhet av programmeringsspråket RPG Fully Free Format eller annat låg/medel nivå-språk, samt om du har kunskaper och erfarenhet av till exempel JIRA, Scrum och testautomation så är det ett plus.
   

  

**Som person** 
 tar du ansvar för helheten och kan själv omsätta kundens behov till genomförbara lösningar. Du är en driven och entusiastisk person som vill vara med och driva utvecklingsprojekt. Du har ett affärsmässigt sätt med fokus på både kvalitet och mål. För att bli framgångsrik i denna roll krävs även att du är kommunikativ, nätverkande samt att du är driven, engagerad och glad. Du uttrycker dig flytande i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig** 
 en kul och utmanande arbetsplats i ett nytänkande företag där våra medarbetare står i fokus. Vi har en öppen och flexibel kultur. Frihet under ansvar, samarbete och feedback är några av hörnstenarna. Vi älskar utmaningar och drivs av att göra våra kunder mer framgångsrika.
   

  

**För mer information** 
 kan du kontakta Team Manager Patrik Franklin patrik.franklin@crosskey.fi +358 405 69 49 99 eller HR Manager Monika Sigmark +358 40 717 8456. Ansök på https://www.crosskey.fi/career senast den 31.7.2025.

title: Game Developer
description:
***Please note - this is an in-house role in our Stockholm office. Remote candidates will not be considered. Unfortunately we cannot help with relocation from other countries or VISA applications.***




  





 Hacksaw Studios is a company that builds online games. We have wide distribution and our games are played by millions of people every month by players all over the world.
 



  





 We are currently looking to expand our development team with 2-3 additional developers and are looking for both junior and senior candidates. You will be part of our game development team and work in a tight knit team involving both front-end developers and designers. Your task will be to bring our game ideas to life in co-operation with the designers and product owners.
 



  





 We offer a nice office in central Stockholm, an opportunity to work with other experienced game developers as well as a co-ownership program for suitable candidates.
 



  





**Your tasks will include:** 




  





 - Work with the development and design team to create new games and update old games, as required
 



 - Maintain and implement new features into our game development framework
 



 - Learn about the online gaming industry and stay up to date on current trends and what is popular with players
 



 - Participate in code reviews and merge requests
 



 - Work on our game development framework which modularizes functionality that gets re-used between games
 



 - Co-operate with colleagues with similar roles, both in-house and with our partners
 



  





**Required skills and experience:** 




  





 - Experience with game development, or a solid development background and a strong desire to learn
 



 - Experience with a programming language suited for game development, such as Javascript, Typescript, C#, Haxe or similar
 



  





**Other things that would be a bonus (but not required):** 




  





 - Experience with some form of game development library, such as Unity, Unreal Engine, Pixi or similar
 



 - Shader programming experience
 



 - 3d programming experience, such as OpenGL
 



 - A working knowledge of how a browser communicates with a back-end server
 



 - Experience in debugging
 



 - Social gaming experience
 



 - A personal interest in games and an understanding of the industry, or a desire to learn
 



  





 To apply for this role, please submit your CV at https://hacksawstudios.bamboohr.com/careers/6

title: Senior Embedded Software Engineer
description:
**Your mission at Voi**
 As a
 **Senior Embedded Software Engineer** 
 you would join our growing IoT team and drive firmware development for our diverse fleet of electric vehicles, focusing on scalability, compliance, and enhanced rider experience.
   

  

**Requirements**
 Our expanding fleet and complex IoT solutions require a unified firmware strategy. Together with the team you'll tackle challenges like diverse vehicle types, varying market requirements, and ongoing innovation projects (next-gen IoT, energy efficiency). We need your expertise to streamline operations and improve our product. This will include:
   

  

* Tech evaluations: Evaluate new technologies and make recommendations for their integration into our micro-mobility devices.
* Embedded software development: Develop, test, and maintain embedded software for our micro-mobility devices.
* CI/CD: Implement continuous integration and continuous delivery processes for our embedded software development.
* Collaborate with the team to design and implement new features and functionalities for our micro-mobility devices.
* Troubleshoot and debug any issues that arise during the development and testing of our embedded software.
* Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in IoT and edge computing, and apply them to our micro-mobility devices.


**What You Need To Embark**
 We’re looking for a Senior Embedded Software professional with experience from working in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment. In addition to being fluent in English, we believe the right person has:
   

  

* Strong C/C++ skills.
* Bachelor's/Master's in Electrical/Computer Engineering.
* The skills to develop our next generation IoT that includes ML on edge and developing frameworks for deploying and implementing ML models on the edge and computer vision systems.
* The skills to ensure efficient data communication and hardware compatibility.
* Experience with low-power IoT firmware development, Cortex M architecture, Zephyr RTOS or similar.
* Experience with bare metal development
* Experience with communication protocols (UART, SPI, I2C, CAN, CANOpen) and familiarity with Network protocols (UDP, COAP, LwM2M)


**Why Voi?**
 Working At Voi Is More Than Just a Job; Our People Promise Includes a Personal Voyage Where You Will Grow As a Professional And Be a Part Of a Team And Culture That Builds Something Meaningful For Society. In Addition To This You’ll Have The Opportunity To
   

  

 Join Europe’s #1 micromobility operator and one of the fastest growing scaleups
   

  

 Get “skin in the game” through our employee options program
   

  

 Lead the future product generations of our vehicles and push the company further towards our product vision and overarching mission of providing “safe, affordable and sustainable micromobility for everyone”
   

  

 Join the micromobility-revolution and be a part of creating sustainable cities made for living, free from noise and pollution
   

  

 Since 2018,
 **Voi** 
 has been on a mission to create safe, sustainable and reliable micromobility for everyone. Today we are the leading shared micromobility operator in Europe, with HQ in Stockholm (Sweden), operating 100,000+ vehicles in 100+ towns and cities across 12 countries, serving 7+ million riders with over 300+ MILLION rides to date, and we have no intention of stopping here! We believe that micromobility will play a central role in changing how people move in our towns and cities in the future and want to ensure that the micromobility transformation happens the right way - through real innovative technology, partnership and transparent dialogue with towns, cities and governments, and by adapting our products to the local needs. In addition to improving quality of life in cities around the world, we are contributing to the solution for climate change by making sustainable transportation options more widely available and promoting renewable energy use and circularity along our supply chain.
   

  

**Diversity Matters**
 As a Voiager, we offer you a friendly, collaborative and fast-paced workplace where you can bring your whole self to work, regardless of gender, age, ethnicity, religion, disability or sexual orientation - and welcome applications from whoever you are, including veterans, those actively serving as a Reservist and their partners. What is most important to us is how you treat others and what skills and value you bring to our team. We believe that having a wide diversity of people with different backgrounds and perspectives within Voi is essential to our success in delivering the best user experience to our equally diverse user base. With employees from over 50 nationalities working within Voi, we believe we have made good progress but know we can still do more - therefore we discourage any photos, personal letters, or disclosure of any information that concerns other information than your professional experience.

title: C# platform developer
description:
*Please note - this is an in-house role in our Stockholm office. Remote candidates will not be considered. Unfortunately we cannot help with relocation from other countries or VISA applications.*
 We’re looking to expand our platform team with an experienced C# developer to help build and maintain the high-performance backend system that powers our remote gaming infrastructure. This platform serves as the backbone for our games, processing large volumes of transactions in real-time with high reliability and efficiency.
   

  

 You will join a team of seasoned developers and work closely with our group CTO to shape the future of our platform.
   

  

**We Offer**
* A central Stockholm office
* Collaboration with top-tier developers
* A co-ownership program for the right candidate


 Key Responsibilities
   

  

* Design and implement robust, scalable features for our C# / ASP.NET-based platform
* Optimize code and data structures for high throughput and low latency
* Write and maintain comprehensive unit tests to ensure platform stability
* Participate in code reviews, contributing to clean and maintainable code
* Maintain clear and thorough technical documentation
* Work closely with peers to ensure architectural consistency and performance standards


 Required Skills & Experience
   

  

* Strong backend development experience in C#
* Solid understanding of ASP.NET (experience preferred, but can be acquired on the job)
* Deep knowledge of SQL, including efficient query writing and high-performance database schema design — crucial for managing thousands of transactions per second
* Practical experience with caching strategies (e.g., in-memory and Redis)
* Expertise in multithreaded programming and thread-safe design patterns
* Proficiency in using the C# debugger for troubleshooting complex issues
* A mindset focused on performance, scalability, and reliability


 Nice-to-Haves
   

  

* Experience with automated unit testing frameworks
* A university degree in Computer Science or related field
* A personal interest in gaming, whether professionally or recreationally
* Experience in basic front-end development

title: Client platform developer
description:
*Please note: This is an in-house role in our Stockholm office. Remote candidates will not be considered. Unfortunately, we cannot help with relocation from other countries or VISA applications.* 




  





**About Hacksaw Studios** 




  





 Hacksaw Studios creates online games that run in both social and real-money modes, played by millions of people worldwide each month. To support our expanding technical landscape, we’re looking for a Client Platform Developer to join our Stockholm team.
 



  





 This position focuses on primarily client-side work—building and maintaining a range of web-based products and tools, from in-game UI and back-office systems to our round-replay system and integration frameworks. However, you may occasionally work on back-end tasks as well. You’ll be part of a small but growing team that spans multiple domains, ensuring our platform remains robust, scalable, and user-friendly for both internal teams and third-party partners.
 



  





**What You’ll Be Doing** 



* Develop and Maintain: Work on core web-based products such as our in-game UI and back-office systems.
* Integration & Collaboration: Manage client-side integrations of our games with various external platforms and support third-party studios building on our OpenRGS platform. Collaborate with back-end teams to align integration strategies with our broader platform architecture.
* Tooling & Automation: Create and maintain help-tools (e.g., scripts for changelog generation, mock clients, game launchers) to optimize workflows across different departments.
* Technical Support: Provide expertise and troubleshooting for platform-related issues, working closely with developers, QA, and customer support teams.
* UX & Visual Detail: Contribute to user-friendly interfaces and ensure a polished look and feel for our products. A good understanding of UX and a keen eye for design are preferred.



  





**What We’re Looking For** 



* Proficiency in JavaScript/TypeScript or a similar language. (Experience with Haxe, our main client-side language, is a plus but not mandatory.)
* Strong Understanding of Web Technologies: Familiarity with browser APIs, cross-origin communication (e.g., postMessage, CORS, WebSockets), and third-party service integrations.
* Debugging & Problem-Solving Skills: Experience using browser DevTools, Postman (or similar tools), and a structured approach to identifying and resolving issues.
* Communication Skills: Ability to articulate technical concepts clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Service-Minded & Proactive: Comfortable owning problems, driving solutions, and collaborating with diverse teams.



  





**Bonus Points:** 




  




* Experience with Git, TypeScript, Linux, bash, npm, Bun, Docker, Cucumber, GitLab, and AWS.
* Experience working with web-related C#.



 If you’re a skilled web developer with a passion for building and integrating we’d love to hear from you!

title: Game Client Framework Developer
description:
Hacksaw Studios are looking for experienced developers to work with our framework for developing casino game clients. We are a relatively young company, but has quickly grown to be a top developer of casino-style games for the iGaming industry. Remote is possible, but we prefer if you are based in EU.
 



  





**The Role:** 




  





 As a framework developer you will work together with the game development teams to deliver features and tools that they need, as well as doing maintenance, bugfixes and performance or usability improvements on existing code. You need to be able to consider all the aspects of implementing a feature, how it affects long term developer productivity and/or memory, GPU and CPU performance. The framework team also handle for example CI pipelines, e2e tests and client integrations, and depending on your skills or interests there are plenty of different technologies to explore.
 



  





 There are very few meetings and a lot of freedom and responsibility to prioritize and specify scope of work, so a great opportunity if you are good at communicating to find the right solution, but also like to be productive and have time to focus on individual tasks.
 



  





**Relevant Experience/Skills:** 




  





 \* Worked with different game development frameworks and some understanding of how they handle structuring of code and rendering of graphics and sound. Ideally with games targeting web for deployment.
 



  





 \* Experience with developing modules and API's to be used by other developers.
 



  





 \* We use Haxe as a programming language for the game clients, but the role does not require previous experience. Haxe should be familiar and quick to learn if you have experience with any C-like language like C#, Java, C++, ActionScript, JS or TS, but if you only have experience with for example OCAML, Haskell or Clojure we would still like to hear from you.
 



  





 \* Our tech stack includes git, TypeScript, Linux, bash, npm, Bun, Docker, Cucumber, GitLab and AWS. Familiarity with any of those tools are beneficial but not required.

title: Developer for MS D365 F&O
description:
Want continuous development and challenging work tasks?
   

  

 Want to be part of a company with a warm and friendly environment?
   

  

 If you have experience developing in Microsoft Dynamics365 Finance & Operations, this is a match made!
   

  

 As a developer on ExFlow, you will have responsibility for your tasks and the opportunity to continue developing your professional skills in a dynamic environment.
   

  

**About The Job**
 As an ExFlow Developer, you will create and maintain customer modifications and ExFlow standard features. This generally means being responsible for creating, maintaining, and improving code based on designs or instructions. As a developer at SignUp Software, you’re not restricted to just developing in X++, development can happen in the power platform, SQL, .Net Framework, or other languages as well, depending on needs and individual skills.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Create and maintain technical designs based on functional designs
* Give input on functional designs
* Develop and maintain solutions and functionality
* Participate in the “Architect board” if requested
* Perform analyses


**Required Skills**
* Experience in developing in D365 F&O (X++)
* Experience in MS Visual Studio
* Experience in MS Azure DevOps
* Five to seven years of experience in D365 F&O/AX development
* Fluent in both Swedish and English, speaking, and writing


**Other Qualifications**
* Experience in developing within AX 2012
* Experience in application MS D365 Finance/Supply Chain Management
* Experience in LCS and troubleshooting
* Experience in Power Platform
* Experience in C# or .Net Framework
* Experience in Azure
* Experience in SQL
* Experience in integrations
* Experience in working with Near/Offshore resources
* Post-secondary education in IT / Systems Science (Computer Science or equivalent)


 To thrive in this role, you have good analytical skills, love problem-solving, be a team player, and structure your tasks and priorities independently. You have an interest in helping others, like to learn new things, and to share your knowledge with others.
   

  

**What We Can Offer You**
* To be part of a successful Swedish company
* To be a part of an international and kind team always close to a laugh
* Helpful colleagues with great competence and experience
* A generous wellness contribution
* Health insurance and occupational pension
* Flexible working hours and the possibility of remote working
* Continuous competence development


**Additional Information**
* Full-time, 40 hours per week
* Start date upon agreement
* The office location is in a new, high-tech office just by Mall of Scandinavia, Solna


 Interviews take place on an ongoing basis during the process.
   

  

**About SignUp**
 SignUp Software was founded in 1999 and introduced ExFlow in 2003. Over the years, SignUp Software has earned a strong reputation in the Microsoft Dynamics community for its solutions in financial process automation. The solutions in the ExFlow product portfolio are built in Microsoft Dynamics 365 and utilize Azure Services, specifically designed for the “Office of the CFO”.
   

  

 SignUp Software currently operates from Sweden (where it is headquartered), Denmark, Netherlands, Spain, UK, USA, Canada, Singapore, and Australia, and has over 130 employees and partnerships with more than 100 resellers worldwide. Globally, over 1,500 customers rely on ExFlow to enhance their financial processes in more
   

  

 than 60 countries.
   

  

 SignUp Software was founded in 1999 and introduced ExFlow in 2003. Over the years, SignUp Software has earned a strong reputation in the Microsoft Dynamics community for its solutions in financial process automation. The solutions in the ExFlow product portfolio are built in Microsoft Dynamics 365 and utilize Azure Services, specifically designed for the “Office of the CFO”.

title: Senior ServiceNow Utvecklare
description:
Centric söker nu en Senior ServiceNow-utvecklare / Business Analyst inom SPM/APM. Vill du vara med och vidareutveckla en av de mest använda ServiceNow-plattformarna i Sverige?
   

  

 Vi söker en engagerad och lösningsorienterad person med erfarenhet av Service Portfolio Management (SPM) och Application Portfolio Management (APM) till vår kund i Stockholm. Du blir en viktig del i ett väletablerat förvaltningsteam där samarbete mellan utvecklare, analytiker, designers och serviceansvariga står i centrum. Tillsammans arbetar ni för att förbättra upplevelsen för över 20 000 användare inom organisationen.
   

  

 Som konsult på Centric får du en trygg anställning och samlar på dig värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Din konsultchef stöttar dig i din utveckling där du hela tiden fyller på med nya erfarenheter och kunskaper. En utmärkt möjlighet att bygga vidare på sina karriär.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 
 I rollen som ServiceNow utvecklare kommer du att ha både ett strategiskt och ett operativt ansvar för vidareutvecklingen av ServiceNow.
   

  

**Dina Arbetsuppgifter Inkluderar**
* Bidra med expertis inom SPM och APM, både på konceptuell och teknisk nivå
* Utveckla och underhålla skript, integrationer och regelverk (t.ex. Business Rules, Client Scripts, Script Includes, ACL)
* Översätta affärsbehov till tekniska lösningar
* Aktivt delta i workshops och samtal med verksamheten för att förstå behov och mål
* Arbeta med olika delar av plattformen som Performance Analytics, CMDB och portföljhantering (SPM/APM)


**Din profil och kvalifikationer** 
**Krav**
* Högskoleutbildning inom relevant område eller motsvarande yrkeserfarenhet
* Gedigen erfarenhet av utveckling i ServiceNow
* Erfarenhet av att implementera och arbeta med SPM-lösningar
* Van att kommunicera och arbeta nära verksamheten, gärna genom workshops och kravinsamling
* Tidigare arbetat med förvaltning, felsökning och incidenthantering
* Talar och skriver flytande på svenska och engelska


**Meriterande kunskaper**
* On-prem eller självhostade lösningar
* Uppgraderingsprojekt i ServiceNow
* Implementering av olika moduler inom plattformen
* Certifieringar som t.ex. CSA, CAD, CIS ITSM, SPM Fundamentals eller CIS-APM


**Övrigt**
*Tjänsten omfattas av säkerhetsskyddade krav och det kan därför krävas att du har specifikt medborgarskap och att du godkänns enligt gällande säkerhetsprövningar.*
**Vad vi erbjuder** 
 Vi hjälper dig att nå dina personliga mål. Vi tycker nämligen att alla våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas, oavsett om de är juniorer eller har några år på nacken. Därför erbjuder vi alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Och inte nog med det – du som konsult får även lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan utifrån dina speciella intresseområden, där vi tar notan för både studiematerial och certifieringar. Hos oss på Centric kommer du snabbt in i gemenskapen genom våra interna och externa aktiviteter där vi träffas och hittar på något roligt tillsammans.
   

  

 Centric är ett IT-företag med 370 anställda, med kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö och Linköping. Vi specialiserar oss på uthyrning av generalister och förmedling av specialister samt erbjuder outsourcing och systemlösningar inom retail. Vi är medlem i Almega Kompetensföretagen och följer deras tecknade kollektivavtal med Unionen.

title: Product Owner - Game Development
description:
At
 **Hacksaw** 
 , we’ve made a name for ourselves by breaking the mould — creating bold, innovative games that disrupt expectations and redefine what mobile-first iGaming content can be. Now, we’re on the hunt for a
 **Product Owner** 
 with a creative edge — someone who doesn’t just manage game development, but helps craft the soul of each title.
 



  





**Your Role:** 




 As a
 **Product Owner** 
 , you’ll be the central creative force behind a portfolio of new games. From concept to launch, you’ll guide the look, feel, and emotional heartbeat of each title — collaborating with a multidisciplinary team of
 **artists, animators, sound designers, musicians, and developers** 
 to deliver games that stand out for their
 **style, polish, and gameplay innovation** 
 .
 



  





 This is a role for someone with
 **vision** 
 — someone who can sense when a spin feels just right, when an animation lands with satisfying impact, and when a sound cue makes a moment unforgettable. You're not here to follow the market — you're here to
 **set the tone** 
 .
 



  





**What You’ll Do:** 



* Own the end-to-end creative development of several game titles
* Collaborate closely with visual and audio teams to define the look, pacing, and feel of each game
* Design and refine unique, engaging game mechanics and animation timing
* Work with developers to ensure the creative vision is technically achievable and polished
* Spot the “X-factor” — that special ingredient that makes a game feel alive
* Maintain alignment between creative ambition and delivery timelines



  





**What We’re Looking For:** 



* Proven experience as a Product Owner in game development
* Deep understanding of game feel: animation flow, visual timing, audio integration, and moment-to-moment engagement
* A keen visual and auditory eye — you know when something looks or sounds “off”
* Strong leadership and communication skills in creative environments
* Experience working cross-functionally in fast-paced, agile teams
* Passion for crafting games that are not just playable — but memorable



  





**Nice to Have:** 



* Experience in the regulated real-money gaming industry
* Familiarity with game engines and production pipelines
* Experience as a software developer or working with software developers
* A portfolio or video reels of past creative work (games you’ve led or significantly shaped)



  





**Why Join Hacksaw?** 




 We’ve built a reputation as one of the most forward-thinking content providers in iGaming — from bold visual design to fresh game mechanics. You’ll be joining a company where
 **creative risk is encouraged** 
 ,
 **quality is non-negotiable** 
 , and your ideas can shape what players around the world experience next.

title: Senior Integration Consultant
description:
**”Accelerating business to improve the lives of people”. This is our purpose statement and encapsulates what we enthusiastically do every day. We integrate our customers’ IT systems to make sure that the right data is at the right place at the right time when they digitalize their processes. Companies need their systems to talk to each other to ensure that cars roll off the factory line, that everyone receives their payments on time, and that you can buy what you need from a supermarket.**
**Our success story began in 1986, when we helped the German automotive industry to digitalize their paper-based supply chains. Today, SEEBURGER is a leading global B2B software provider with more than 1,000 #businessaccelerators in 15 countries worldwide and over 10,000 satisfied customers that rely on our innovative solutions.**
**The Position**
 At SEEBURGER, integration is more than a buzzword—it's our mission. As a trusted global leader in business integration, we serve customers ranging from local SMEs to the world’s top financial institutions, logistics providers, retailers and automotive giants.
   

  

 We are searching for a
 **Senior Integration Consultant to join our growing team in Sweden** 
 . This is a key role for someone who wants to work hands-on with integration solutions, support strategic digital transformation, and guide clients with best-practice architecture and implementation.
   

  

 Location: Ideally based in Stockholm, Sweden. Some travel expected for customer workshops and kick-offs.
   

  

 As a Senior Integration Consultant at SEEBURGER, you'll work at the intersection of technology and business, designing, implementing, and optimizing integration flows using our Business Integration Suite (BIS). You'll collaborate closely with clients and internal teams, bringing together systems, applications, and business processes into a cohesive digital ecosystem.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities**
* Implement integration flows using SEEBURGER BIS, with a focus on B2B/EDI, API, EAI, and MFT.
* Design and adapt integration architectures tailored to customer requirements.
* Work closely with customers to analyze existing processes, identify improvements, and advise on the optimal integration strategy.
* Support technical workshops, onboarding sessions, and customer training initiatives.
* Contribute in pre-sales efforts when needed by offering technical insights and validating integration use cases.
* Build strong, long-term relationships with customers and become a trusted technical advisor.


**Your Profile**
* 5+ years of experience in IT integration or related consulting roles.
* Hands-on experience in at least one or more of the following: B2B integration, MFT, EAI, or API management.
* Solid understanding of IT infrastructure, including Windows/Linux environments, databases, and application servers.
* Strong communication skills and an ability to understand and articulate customer needs.
* Ability to drive smaller integration projects independently, and contribute to larger project teams.
* A developer mindset – comfortable reading code and understanding how systems interact, though this is not a coding-heavy role.
* Fluent in Swedish and English.


**Nice to Have**
* Experience with integration platforms like Mulesoft, Axway, IBM, Dell Boomi, or SAP PI/PO.
* Familiarity with messaging standards like EDIFACT, XML, JSON, SWIFT, etc.
* Skills in Java, scripting languages, Docker, CI/CD tools (e.g., Jenkins).
* Previous work with industries such as automotive, logistics, retail, manufacturing, or finance.


**Why Join SEEBURGER?**
* Be part of a growing, global company with strong local presence in Sweden.
* Work hands-on with industry-leading integration technology.
* Join a tight-knit and experienced team where collaboration, knowledge sharing, and mutual support are core values.
* Enjoy a hybrid work setup – we encourage in-office collaboration (typically 3 days per week in Stockholm or Gothenburg), with flexibility depending on project needs.
* Influence the digital journeys of leading companies while building your own technical and strategic expertise.


 If you’re passionate about integration, eager to work with real impact across diverse industries, and enjoy guiding customers with a hands-on and consultative approach — we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

**Benefit from being part of a globally renowned company that is driving digitalisation forward. We continue to grow - and so can you! It is important to us that you can fully utilise your talents and strengths and go your own way, regardless of whether you are aiming for a specialist or management career. With our expertise and growth in a future-oriented industry, we offer a wide range of opportunities and secure jobs. At SEEBURGER, we value the supportive atmosphere and family environment. #StrongerTogether is one of our corporate values and characterises the way we live together.**
**Sounds exciting? Become a #Businessaccelerator today!**

title: Salesforce System Owner
description:
**About The Role**
 Are you a Salesforce professional with a blend of administrative and development skills? Do you enjoy owning and optimizing systems end-to-end? Join Tacton as our Salesforce System Owner, where you'll play a pivotal role in scaling our Salesforce ecosystem to support our growing business operations.
   

  

 You'll be part of our Revenue Operations team, collaborating cross-functionally with a group of engaged and talented colleagues. You’ll place yourself in the shoes of internal business users, work with process flow charts to help visualize problems and proposed solutions, leverage AI to be more efficient and own/deliver the changes that need to be made – In short, you will be the Salesforce subject matter expert that has the platform expertise to drive change!
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
* Platform Ownership: Manage the full Salesforce platform, including user management, permissions, profiles, roles, and record types.
* Declarative Automation: Design, build, and optimize Salesforce Flows, validation rules, formula fields, and Lightning UI enhancements.
* Programmatic Development: Develop and maintain Apex classes, triggers, and test methods to support custom business logic.
* Governance & Documentation: Ensure platform governance, maintain comprehensive documentation, and uphold scalability best practices.
* Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, and Product teams to gather requirements and implement solutions.
* What You Bring Experience: Hands-on Salesforce experience in a combined Admin/Developer role.
* Technical Skills: Proficiency in Salesforce Flows, Apex development, and data management.
* Platform Knowledge: Solid understanding of the Salesforce data model, security model, and platform limits.
* Tools Familiarity: Experience with tools like Data Loader and VS Code.
* Languages: Excellent communication skills in English, both spoken and written.


**Qualifications (not a Requirement)**
* Salesforce certifications (e.g., Platform Developer I, Admin).
* Knowledge of JavaScript, Python, or other scripting languages.
* Marketing Automation (e.g., Pardot, Hubspot)
* Middleware (e.g., Mulesoft, Workato)
* CPQ (e.g., Zuora, Kugamon, Tacton)
* DocGen (e.g., Docusign)
* Revenue Intelligence (Gong, Salesloft, Outreach, ZoomInfo)


**Who You Are**
 We’re looking for someone who is eager to understand our business, who brings strong initiative and a passion for continuous improvement and development. In this role, you’ll collaborate with colleagues across all functions and roles – so being an excellent collaborator and communicator is key.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* Ownership: Full ownership of a strategic, business-critical platform.
* Culture: A collaborative, open, and inclusive culture built on trust and innovation.
* Impact: The opportunity to make a tangible difference across teams.
* Benefits: 33 vacation days, private healthcare insurance, a generous wellness allowance, and more.


**About Tacton**
 Tacton is a global SaaS leader in CPQ (Configure, Price, Quote), empowering manufacturers to streamline complex sales processes and drive growth. Headquartered in Stockholm with offices in Chicago, Karlsruhe, and Warsaw, we’re a 220-person team on an exciting growth journey. Recognized by Gartner as a market leader, our technology helps global manufacturers solve real-world configuration challenges and stay competitive in a rapidly changing world. Learn more at tacton.com/about
   

  

 Tacton is a leading SaaS company within CPQ and Design Automation making sales simple for complex products.

title: Founding Product Designer
description:
Grands is a tennis platform that helps people find matches and join social tennis events. Whether it’s one-on-one, doubles, or something bigger, Grands makes it easy to discover and play with others nearby.
 



  





 We’ve built a fully functional product in-house that’s live and running. Over 1,000 players have already joined, and people are playing daily through the platform or at the social tennis events we organise.
 



  





**We’re not hiring employees. We’re looking for more founding team members.** 
 People with an entrepreneurial mindset who want to build something meaningful on the side, from wherever they are. This is a long-term project and you’ll get equity from day one.
 



  





 We’re based across Sydney, Stockholm, and Helsinki. It doesn’t matter where you are, but it helps if you like tennis.
 



  





**You** 




  





 We’re looking for a product designer to take the lead on designing the next version of Grands across mobile and web. You’ll rethink and refine how players discover matches, join events, and interact with others on the platform.
 



  





 We’re not interested in resumes or previous job titles. What matters is your ability to design clear, intuitive, user-friendly products. You should be comfortable working independently and iterating quickly based on feedback from real players.
 



  





 This isn’t a full-time job or a freelance gig. It’s a side project that we take seriously and are building for the long run. You can work on your own schedule and from anywhere. If you’re excited by the idea of making tennis more social and accessible, we’d love to hear from you.

description:
**Plats:** Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö.
  
**Varaktighet:** 6 till 18 månader (Möjlighet till förlängning), beroende på kundens behov.
  
**Anställningsform:** Konsultuppdrag.
  
Imployy växer!!
  
Just nu utökar vi vår kandidatbank med de mest kvalificerade kandidaterna för att matcha dem med både befintliga och nya kunder. Vi är engagerade i att hitta den perfekta matchningen för varje kandidat och varje tjänst.
  
  

**Arbetsbeskrivning:**  

Vi söker en erfaren Projektledare som vill bli en del av vårt team och driva framgångsrik projektleverans för vår kund.
  
I denna roll ansvarar du för att planera, genomföra och leverera projekt i tid och inom uppsatta ramar. Du kommer att samarbeta med tvärfunktionella team och intressenter för att säkerställa effektiv projektledning och strategisk samordning.
  
  

**Arbetsuppgifter:**  

Leda och hantera projekt från start till mål med leverans inom tid, budget och omfattning.
  
Utveckla och underhålla projektplaner, riskbedömningar och statusrapporter.
  
Koordinera tvärfunktionella team och säkerställa tydlig kommunikation och anpassning till affärsmål.
  
Hantera intressenters förväntningar och ge regelbundna projektuppdateringar.
  
Identifiera potentiella risker och ta fram åtgärdsplaner.
  
Säkerställa efterlevnad av branschstandarder, bästa praxis och företagets riktlinjer.
  
Driva kontinuerlig förbättring genom att analysera projektresultat och implementera lärdomar.
  
  

**Krav för att söka tjänsten:**  

Akademisk examen inom ekonomi, teknik, IT eller ett närliggande område.
  
Dokumenterad erfarenhet som projektledare, gärna inom IT-, telekom- eller teknikprojekt.
  
God kunskap om projektmetodiker såsom Agile, Scrum och Waterfall.
  
Erfarenhet av projektledningsverktyg som Jira, Trello eller MS Project.
  
Utmärkta ledaregenskaper samt stark kommunikations- och intressenthanteringsförmåga.
  
Förmåga att arbeta under press och hantera flera projekt samtidigt.
  
Flytande i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.
  
  

**Följande är meriterande:**  

Certifieringar inom projektledning (t.ex. PMP, PRINCE2 eller likvärdigt).
  
Erfarenhet av förändringsledning och processförbättring.
  
Bakgrund inom IT, mjukvaruutveckling eller teknisk projektledning.
  
  

**Varför jobba med oss? Vad vi erbjuder:**  

* Möjlighet att arbeta med meningsfulla projekt hos förstklassiga kunder.
* Konkurrenskraftig lön och förmåner.
* En inkluderande arbetsmiljö där alla är välkomna.
* En stödjande och utvecklingsinriktad arbetsplats.
* Vi har kollektivavtal, vilket innebär trygga anställningsvillkor, tjänstepension, försäkringar och andra förmåner.


Ditt CV och dina uppgifter kommer att sparas i vår databas, och vi kommer att se till att matcha dem med rätt kund och rätt tjänst när möjligheten uppstår. Vi genomför intervjuer löpande och ser fram emot att välkomna vår nästa kollega till teamet.
  
På Imployy är vi engagerade i att bygga en mångsidig och talangfull arbetsstyrka genom att koppla samman skickliga yrkespersoner med rätt möjligheter. Vi fokuserar på att matcha kandidater baserat på deras expertis, erfarenhet och karriärmål. Vår arbetsmetod präglas av integritet, innovation och en passion för att skapa meningsfulla karriärvägar.
  
För att läsa mer om oss och vad vi gör, besök gärna www.imployy.com.
  
Öppen för alla
  
Vi fokuserar på din kompetens, inte dina övriga förutsättningar. Vi är öppna för att anpassa rollen eller arbetsplatsen efter dina behov.

title: Product Owner
description:

**Varaktighet:** 6 till 18 månader (Möjlighet till förlängning), beroende på kundens behov.
  
**Anställningsform:** Konsultuppdrag.
  
Imployy växer!!
  
Just nu utökar vi vår kandidatbank med de mest kvalificerade kandidaterna för att matcha dem med både befintliga och nya kunder. Vi är engagerade i att hitta den perfekta matchningen för varje kandidat och varje tjänst.
  
  

**Arbetsbeskrivning:**  

Vi söker en erfaren Product Owner som vill bli en del av vårt team och leda produktutvecklingen för vår kund.
  
I denna roll fungerar du som länken mellan affärsbehov och tekniska lösningar, med målet att maximera värdet för användare och intressenter.

Äga och hantera produktens backlog samt prioritera funktioner utifrån affärsvärde.
  
Samarbeta med intressenter för att samla in krav och definiera tydliga produktmål.
  
Arbeta nära utvecklingsteam för att säkerställa smidig genomförande av produktplaner.

Kontinuerligt analysera produktens prestanda och användarfeedback för att styra vidareutveckling.
  
  

**Krav för att söka tjänsten:**  

Akademisk examen inom ekonomi, IT eller ett närliggande område.
  
Dokumenterad erfarenhet som produktägare eller i en liknande roll.
  
God förståelse för agila metoder och ramverk, särskilt Scrum.
  
Utmärkta kommunikationsförmågor och vana att hantera intressenter.
  
Förmåga att översätta affärsbehov till tekniska krav.
  
Flytande i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.
  
  

**Följande är meriterande:**  

Certifiering som produktägare (t.ex. CSPO, SAFe PO/PM).
  
Erfarenhet från tech-, telekom- eller finansbranschen.
  
Vana att arbeta med verktyg som Jira, Confluence och Figma.

Ditt CV och dina uppgifter kommer att sparas i vår databas, och vi kommer att se till att matcha dem med rätt kund och rätt tjänst när möjligheten uppstår. Vi genomför intervjuer löpande och ser fram emot att välkomna vår nästa kollega till teamet.
  
På Imployy är vi engagerade i att bygga en mångsidig och talangfull arbetsstyrka genom att koppla samman skickliga yrkespersoner med rätt möjligheter. Vi fokuserar på att matcha kandidater baserat på deras expertis, erfarenhet och karriärmål. Vår arbetsmetod präglas av integritet, innovation och en passion för att skapa meningsfulla karriärvägar.
  
För att läsa mer om oss och vad vi gör, besök gärna www.imployy.com.

title: IT-tekniker vid behov
description:
Jobbannons – Behovsanställda L1 IT-tekniker sökes över hela Sverige
  
TechServices IT fortsätter växa och söker nu fler behovsanställda L1 IT-tekniker till vårt team. Vi söker dig som vill arbeta extra vid behov och har grundläggande IT-kunskaper. Tjänsten innebär varierande IT-uppdrag ute hos våra kunder runtom i Sverige.
  
Om tjänsten
  
Som L1-tekniker är du först på plats vid enklare IT-relaterade problem. Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter kan inkludera:
  
Felsökning och grundläggande problemlösning av IT-relaterade problem, både på plats och på distans
  
  

Grundläggande felsökning av nätverk och internetuppkopplingar
  
  

Hantering av Microsoft 365-miljö (t.ex. kontoskapande, lösenordsåterställning)
  
  

Hantering av Active Directory (AD)
  
  

Support och installation av skrivare och enklare skrivarlösningar
  
  

IT-support över telefon, mail och på plats hos kund
  
  

Arbetet är behovsbaserat vilket innebär att vi kontaktar dig när vi har uppdrag i ditt närområde. Du har frihet att tacka ja eller nej till uppdrag utifrån din tillgänglighet.
  
Kvalifikationer
  
För att trivas och kunna utföra jobbet behöver du uppfylla följande:
  
Förmåga att självständigt felsöka och lösa enklare IT-problem
  
  

Grundläggande kunskaper i nätverk (ex. DHCP, DNS, IP-adressering)
  
  

Erfarenhet av Microsoft 365 och/eller Active Directory
  
  

Erfarenhet av skrivare och enklare skrivarlösningar
  
  

Kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska (krav) och engelska (meriterande)
  
  

Kan arbeta självständigt, noggrant och med hög servicekänsla
  
  

Innehav av B-körkort är meriterande, men inget krav
  
  

Meriterande
  
Certifieringar inom IT (t.ex. Microsoft, CompTIA eller motsvarande)
  
  

Tidigare erfarenhet av liknande arbete
  
  

Vi erbjuder
  
Flexibla arbetsmöjligheter utifrån din tillgänglighet
  
  

Möjlighet till fler uppdrag vid goda prestationer
  
  

Stöd från ett erfaret och hjälpsamt team
  
  

Marknadsmässig timlön
  
  

Så ansöker du
  
Skicka in ditt CV och en kort beskrivning av dig själv till rekrytering@techservicesit.se. Ange "Behovsanställd L1-tekniker" i ämnesraden. Urval sker löpande och vi kontaktar endast aktuella kandidater.
  
Vi värdesätter mångfald och välkomnar sökande oavsett bakgrund, ålder eller kön.
  
TechServices IT – Ditt nästa steg i IT-branschen!

title: Data Analyst
description:
**YOUR MISSION AT VOI**
**Role**
 As a Data Analyst at Voi your primary responsibility will be to facilitate informed decision-making by providing actionable insights and recommendations based on data analysis. Your contributions will play a pivotal role in our ongoing success in the 12 countries we operate in. By joining Voi, you’re joining a truly data driven company where the data team is at the forefront:
   

  

* Build decision support tools using data, metrics and dashboards
* Guide operational decisions and help product teams build the best products
* Solve business and product problems through data analysis
* Present your insights and recommendations to stakeholders
* Extract, manipulate and visualize data to find and understand patterns
* Clean data to develop features and signals in a vast, unordered data set
* Help the organization learn from data by advising on performance indicators, tests and analytical methodologies
* Teach team members and lead the way for data driven ways of working


**What You’ll Need To Embark**
 Being part of our team means to challenge the status quo and to drive change where you see needed, both in terms of how we work internally and how our operations execute. We believe you have an ability and willingness to learn and adapt to a changing environment, it also means to be a great team player and help us build a fantastic place to work! In addition to being fluent in English we believe the right person has:
